intro: Hieracium nigroturbinatum, commonly known as the black turban hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its distinctive, dark purple to blackish flower heads that resemble small turban-like structures. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Hieracium nigroturbinatum is an herbaceous perennial that produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers, which are followed by small, dry seeds.
